greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Odd primes generated recursively: a(1) = 3, a(n) = Min {p is prime; p divides Q+2}, where Q is the product of previous terms in the sequence.
comment: The first five terms comprise the known Fermat primes: A019434.
link: Sean A. Irvine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..64
results.author: Nick Hobson (http://www.qbyte.org/puzzles/), Nov 18 2006
